website_summaries.verdict: Excellent grip on the sole of shoe for the traction you'll need when hiking on unsteady ground.
pros: Shoe's design makes it easy to slip on and off
Includes lace design that makes tightening the shoe simple
Latest design model in a very popular brand of hiking shoe
cons: Questionable durability around the toe box
Sizes tend to run a bit small

customer_reviews.title: My fifth pair - awesome trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: My fifth pair of Salomon Speedcross. Absolutely swear by them. When I run trails I typically run around 20 miles, sometimes more. Wore these a few days ago for the first time on a 28 mile mountain run. Perfect, perfect, perfect. GREAT grip, very luggy, almost like cleats but manages to be exceptionally light. Cushioned well, but not so well that you lost the feel of the trail beneath your feet. I find it incredibly valuable, especially on rocky or technical trails, to be able to feel the ground. I generally put between 400-500 miles on them before retirement.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: SUPER NARROW!
customer_reviews.text: I have average width feet. But since I saw this shoe runs narrow I ordered wide. The wide was WAY WAY WAY too narrow! Im amazed the brand hasnt put a stop to this because the narrow-ness of a WIDE was just too ridiculously narrow, so much so that even if this was a regular and not a wide, it was still too narrow for that. So if you know you have very narrow feet, buy a wide and you might be okay. No one should buy the regular. If the wide is that narrow, I imagine the regular couldn't hold a hot dog!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They start to break apart in their 1st trip.
customer_reviews.text: They are light, you don't feel a thing walking on small rocks, kinda slippery on the big ones specialy if they are wet, very confortable, but if they break apart on your 1st trip, all the good things go to a waste, can’t be more disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Jose Perez Castro

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT the Salomon speedcross 4s your looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I have two pair of these shoes. Bought the first pair about a year ago and even though they have a couple holes, they are still pretty usable. I decided to get this new pair and these have to be some generic shoe. The material is not the same, the tread pattern is not the same, the sides have started to crack and split after just 2-3 trail runs in places my old ones don’t have any cracks or splits. Everything about these shoes are cheaper quality than my other ones bought elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: JWP

customer_reviews.title: SOFTBALL-FANTASTIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Nike's. These fit a little snug at first, but after getting a little bit of running in them, they fit very well! I use them for softball, and they work EXCEPTIONALLY WELL! They work better than any of the cleats that I have purchased in the past several years.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Tuft

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sold a counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: I received a counterfeit product. You can see the soles were separating at the heel and that is a fake quicklace system. The patent number should be on the tab and the locking tab itself is completely incorrect. I’ve heard of people getting fake items off Amazon, first time I’ve seen it. Disappointed in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Waymorefresha

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I hike with a backpack on a daily basis. If I can't be on a trail, I will backpack on roads. The Salomon's soles fell apart in only a few months. My issue with the soles was not due to manufacturing quality but the shoe material could not endure regular wear and tear. I wore this shoe in a size 2 larger sizes (1/2 size up and as a wide) but they still felt too tight on the top of my feet. I will continue to buy Salomon products but I won't buy the Speedcross again.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: I'll buy these forever
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. This is actually my second pair after I had the speedcross 3 for about two and a half years. I wore them to the Grand Canyon and my feet didn't hurt at all. Great shoes, very comfortable, keeps my feet dry and great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stable and light
customer_reviews.text: Break-in review, 5 miles in hilly, rocky terrain, on and off trail, as well as grass. Fits well. I wear 10 and a half, sometimes 11. These 10.5 fit snug with adequate room. The lacing system is excellent. Very secure and comfortable fit. Functionally similar to wearing cleats but with good traction on rocks. Narrow and not clunky through technical sections. Light and efficient. Grip is excellent and inspires confidence at all times. Durability is questionable. A few abrasions show in the toe box area already. The wide cleat pattern will probably not last on hard, abrasive surfaces. Overall, this is an excellent Trail Runner. Five well-deserved Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Grippy, light, great for trail running
customer_reviews.text: I ran a trail marathon with these in Vermont, the grippiness of the soles is really fantastic, and the space between the 'spikes' (sorry not sure what to call these) is deep enough to allow for mud and debris to fall away and not get compacted. They felt as light as I could expect for the product--the stiff toe and sole keeps you from 'feeling' rocks under your feet which prevents soreness. The downside--these are VERY slippery on wet rocks. I kept sliding off. So if you have stream crossings in your running keep this in mind. Another downside is that when mud gets caked in the shoelaces, because of the quick tie feature, it's hard to slide them off.
customer_reviews.author: Asli E

customer_reviews.title: Supplier keeps sending the wrong shoe width - I want WIDE...
customer_reviews.text: Over the last year I guess, I've ordered 3 pairs of shoes from this supplier, each time hoping they have sorted out the problem, but no. I order 10 WIDE, and get 10 Standard. The Wide fit have the word WIDE in superscript next to the 4 on the outside of the shoe where it says SPEEDCROSS 4. I know this because I have been wearing them for years now. This leaves me to 1 or 2 conclusions, 1. They just don't care that their bar codes are on the wrong boxes, or 2. these are not the genuine shoe. Right now I'm leaning towards 2, these are a knock off copies. In ether case I'm done with this supplier.
customer_reviews.author: PXTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Spartan approved shoes
customer_reviews.text: Used these in a Super Spartan race in Ottawa Ca last week. From the time I ordered the shoes and the time they arrived I wasn't able break them in, but that was my fault for procrastinating with ordering them a couple days before the race. These shoes performed amazing running up and down the mountain, the lacing system was fast and straight to the point, the traction was unbeatable in the trails.
customer_reviews.author: miller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed X2!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son-in-law for Christmas...it’s a tradition...he gets a pair from me every year. We’ve never had an issue until this year. The first pair broke the moment he put them on. The string eyelet snapped off instantly. I returned them and got him a replacement pair and the exact same thing happened. I am returning them again but will not get another pair like this. They are one of the most expensive styles they offer but definitely the cheapest made. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Such a Beautiful Shoe, wear REALLY REALLY FAST!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many pairs of the Speedcross4, I honestly think they are using weaker rubber to get more sales. For $130+ each pair and about 3 months life expectancy for daily wear. Yes I know they are trail running, I prefer aggressive traction with my work. Last pair lasted about 5 months, had this pair for about a week and I thought they might be counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: Frayed Knot

customer_reviews.title: Defective or fake
customer_reviews.text: Either I received a fake or a highly defective product. The shoe has openings on the bottom and the sides looked like they were glued together. Needless to say, I’ve sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Saba C.

customer_reviews.title: Sneakers started falling apart after being worn 4 times within ...
customer_reviews.text: Sneakers started falling apart after being worn 4 times within a month. Sole was coming off, glue wasn't holding. Not sure if Amazon sold knockoffs or quality is no longer there, but I lost $20 due to restocking fees and the item being returned over 30 days. Was a fan of the brand, time to move on to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Askiy

customer_reviews.title: i am keeping the shoe and will just continue to wear them with thin socks but will be looking for a different style next year.
customer_reviews.text: early last year i bought the same style pair at the size i normally wear, 9.5. i found that i could only wear them with thin socks. i decided that when the time came i would buy the same pair again but a half size larger (10), as I have done on 2 other occasions when it was time to replace shoes. well they changed the design and the shoe is much more narrow in addition to the webbing over the tongue that comes up higher on the shoe. that makes it a tight squeeze to jam my foot in to the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Arr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but don’t last and poor warranty via amazon
customer_reviews.text: updating our review again. My husband finds these shoes very comfortable and has been buying them for 3 years but clearly amazon doesn’t have a way to honor the real Solomon warranty. For this price they should last longer then 5months!!! They’re already falling apart. He wears them daily while dog training in our back yard. Doesn’t seem like pacing on grass should cause this degree of wear. Definitely cheaper brands with the same 4-6 mo longevity. 2 stars for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to give these a 5/5 star :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a Spartan Sprint race. As much as I loved the shoes I hate them too. From the 2nd mile the insole of the right shoe went loose and curled up. Third mile the left shoe also had the same issue :( I had to take off my shoe couple of times and fix the insole but it didn't work. The shoes are perfect in terms of grip and support. You will conquer the slippery trails easily. But do you want a curled up insole? Don't think so! I will try other brands next time. Disappointed Salomon. You could do better!
customer_reviews.author: APS624

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in Nov. of 2018 and have most likely already put near 4/500 miles on them. Right out of the box, these shoes feel broken in and our extremely comfortable. They are narrow, but that's how Salomon is made, always have been, so if you have wide feet, just find something different. These are definitely not rain hiking/running shoes, your feet/socks will be soaked....quickly. But, on a sunny day, running on trail, or hiking through the woods, you'd be hard pressed to find a better shoe. I may not wear Salomon shoes for road running, but when it comes to any type of off road activity, you will find me in these, ALWAYS!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Reeve

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoe. Supportive fit
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful shoe. Supportive fit, sleek design. Does fit a bit narrow, and becomes tight with wool trail socks. The toe mesh holds water stains, but cleans up with a wipe down. The sole is super grippy, but squeeks on hard surfaces. The logo tag on the fixed tongue shifts to the outside, making it look like the tongue itself shifted even tho that's not possible. I'll be gluing that down. The speed lace is nice, but sometimes slips out of the pocket when running.
customer_reviews.author: igz

customer_reviews.title: I swear by Speedcross 4's This is my third pair over the last 3 years- I love them.
customer_reviews.text: They are one of those shoes that you either love them or hate them. Instantly my knees and back feel relief when I put them on. I save my new pairs as much as I can for obstacle races and keep the old ones for everything else. Aside from having a good running shoe for roads etc, you should own a set of these. Once you get your first pair of the speedcross 4's you will understand. I have heard some negative about the design issues with speedcross 5's but all three of the pairs I own- seem to be top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Surrell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic trail runners - used for soccer reffing!
customer_reviews.text: While these are trailer runners, I'm not a trail runner. I am a hiker and I also referee soccer. I saw a recommendation to use these to referee soccer and figured I'd give them a shot. The treads are huge - they'd be great for trail running / hiking in sloppy conditions. The shoe is also fantastic as a soccer referee shoe. Comfortable for all day wear. The lace garage keeps you from accidentally untying your laces / having to kneel down to retie them during a soccer game. Black (referee) color works. Highly recommended both for sloppy trails or soccer fields in any condition!
customer_reviews.author: Informed ConsumerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: I ran in the Speedcross 3 for several years. They were a bit small and thin but I liked the snug feel. This time I bought 1/2 size larger and the fit is excellent. Still snug and a bit longer but not an issue at all. The lugs clear the mud pretty well and drainage after running through a creek is good. The cushioning is great for me. It keeps the constant pounding of the trail from transmitting up to my lower back. I've ran in most competing brands for years. Salomon is the best in my book. Thanks Salomom for making a great trail shoe at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To for Everyday Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've used these in one verion or another since SpeedCross 2. They last about 1-1/2 to 2 years with nearly everday use. I work in high-end finished homes. The tread is spread-out so mud and other debris doesn't get hung up. A quick wipe on an outside doormat and I'm confident the debris is off. These are also easy to remove and slip back on without touching the laces or bending over. The shoes stay snug. Love the higher than normal arches too. I have also owned the La Sportiva equivalent but the tread didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burnham

customer_reviews.title: One Tough Mudder!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ran over 100 Tough Mudders and four 24 hour World Championships and for me, this has been my go-to shoe. A very aggressive and perfect tread pattern for incline muddy/slippery hills and trails. Water doesn’t hold in the shoe and my foot breathes easily in it. Has a snug, but very comfortable fit and extremely durable shoe that takes a beating, while other shoes I’ve had blowouts and the tread wears out quickly; not these! And comfortable enough to run on pavement and sidewalks if need to during race events.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great traction in mud and tough terrain
customer_reviews.text: Last year I completed my spartan trifecta in these shoes. This included a very muddy beast. Other racers were slipping left and right clinging onto trees and clawing for handholds. With these shoes I was able to just run on by. They have excellent traction. Their construction is also such that if they get submerged in water they drain very quickly instead of staying soggy. The one thing that prevented me from giving this 5 stars is they have a tendency to give me blisters. However, I may have gotten a half size too small.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Salomon shoes are awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good pair of shoes when I ran across someone who had a pair of these and they recommended them to me. I checked them out and went back and forth for two days whether to get them or not. I decided to take a chance and I’m glad I did. They fit great and sized exactly like my old pair of shoes of a different brand. The look abs feel great too. I use these shoes for both work and play and they do very well for both.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Bryant

customer_reviews.title: keep looking. this's not worth your hard earned Dollar.
customer_reviews.text: have to give 1 star. reason being that the distance from sole is too close.The bottoms are too skinny,rips off too easily. i don't expect to pay this much for a shoe that only lasts a month. they could do better. The first pair was replaced and it started ripping the same day that i got it. But the comfort is crazy nice. i wish they were a little bit more tough to handle any weather and conditions.
customer_reviews.author: khalid

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend and he LOVES them! I have a pair of Salomons and I wear them to our hikes all the time and feel so comfy, I don't slip, very good tread. My boyfriend struggled with his Adidas shoes, slipping and sliding through the trails. I bought him these and now he feels like he is off-roading on a truck lol. Very good investment! Sturdy, comfortable, long-lasting. I have had mine for years and every time I wash them after a hike they look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe for its quality of construction and functionality--whether for walking, running or (yes, Virginia) golf. The boa-like closure is super for quick on/off fitment. Good looking casual design. However, the M is not equivalent to a legacy D width--it's a little narrower at the sole. I would recommend a W if you have slightly wider feet (former D width) or if you wear quality athletic socks.
customer_reviews.author: Silverseal99

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof is important, but the trade-off is that it makes the shoe warmer. I wear this in rainy fall/winter weather to meet workplace requirements and I do not have to work a shift with soggy feet after a dash across a flooded parking lot in the rain. Tread surface wears quickly due to decreased material- the cost of increased traction. The shoelace clasp sometimes walks off the tongue of the shoe and becomes uncomfortable, this is rare. Slip-off function the way I tension the laces. Lots of compliments. My second pair. No unusual material wear or failures.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe for trails
customer_reviews.text: I use this for dirt hills. The traction is great. It's like a tire for these dirt trails. I did not find it great for street running. However, the shoelace plastic snapped within 5 months. I have to order a replacement (minimum $10) and apparently watch a YouTube video to replace it. This is the down side. I have mixed impressions of the lacing system. I can't really use the shoes until the replacement laces arrive and I have time to install it
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer R

customer_reviews.title: One of the best shoes for trail running
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awesome! They are definitely designed for the trail and fit like a glove. If you have medium to narrow feet and like a shoe that wraps around your foot and feels like it was fitted specifically for you, then these shoes are for you. The only drawback is if you're not currently on the trail, the aggressive lugs can make you feel a little unstable walking on finished floors or concrete, but don't let that deter you from buying this awesome running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent shoes for hiking in mixed terrain
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent shoes for hiking in mixed terrain. The cut is low enough that they don’t rub the bottom of my ankle bone. They are adequately cushioned, but are better with cushioned socks. The lacing system has held up well. I have worn them on several hikes in Grand Mesa, where they served me well. My only complaint is that the cleats tear off too easily. I am not overly hard on shoes and am well within my BMI, and expect shoes that cost close to $100 to last longer than 4 to five hikes. However, they fit so well and worked so well I do highly recommend them. My old pair will become my beater shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Surlyman

customer_reviews.title: the grip was amazing, the fit was amazing
customer_reviews.text: Used these shoes for my first mud run, I am not athletic, but I was killing the obstacles, the grip was amazing, the fit was amazing, and the gross dried up mud came off in the washer 2 days after I ran the race. I loved these shoes, the race didn't even scratch them or wear them out at the bottom at all. awesome shoes. I am a 6 in womens, these are a 7 mens, they still stayed on my feet even though they were a little big where the toes are.
customer_reviews.author: AUTUMN

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I’ve ever owned. I’m 53, former military and I’ve excersised most of my life. I’ve always bought the other major name brands mostly when they were on sale and they just never fit how I wanted them to but I ran in them nevertheless and they never lasted as long as I expected them to. These shoes fit like a glove but not too tight and are super comfortable. I run on trails and a lot of uneven ground and so far I haven’t been disappointed. These shoes make my running even more enjoyable and I look forward to seeing how long they last, I would definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Prime

customer_reviews.title: Wear out way too fast.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mainly for trail running but my knees kind of gave out so I ended up using them for an average walk of 5 miles x 2 times a week for about 2 months on asphalt and for all intents and purposes the bottom tread has completely worn off. The inside of the heel on the left foot has a hole in the fabric already. I’ve had several blisters from these shoes. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Randolf Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my feet dry without sacrificing compfort
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with these! Water proof in the snow. They keep my feet dry and warm even in -20 weather when I go on a short walk with the dog. It's great not to have to put boots on for quick outdoor activity in the wet and cold. I run out in the morning and feed horses and my pants are wet but my feet are toasty when I get in the car for work. The arch support is great. They are very comfortable. They appeared too narrow for my wide feet when I took them out of the box but when I wore them omg amazing fit. These are by far the perfect winter tennis shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Marisha

customer_reviews.title: Sized way too small, at least for less than perfect feet
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Salomon for years, this was the first time I had to return a pair of their shoes. I could barely put my feet in them, and when I did they hurt, so I sent them back and shall find another style. I hope this isn't the trend, but these fit like Nikes - so if you have perfect feet then by all means buy these, otherwise stay away because they were too narrow and too tight for me. Quality is superior for those still interested - they are so well made.
customer_reviews.author: Osiris

customer_reviews.title: I has Hobbit feet, and these wide puppies fit wonderfully! Worked great for Spartan race
customer_reviews.text: I originally got the non-wide version but had to return them. These wide shoes fit perfectly. Can't rave about them enough. I broke them in at the gym on the treadmill and had no problem, no blisters. Yeah they're a little stiff, but you get used to it. On the Spartan race they worked great! Can't rave about them enough as they chewed up the hills, making the hills much less slippery. Will definitely buy again, but they appear to be so solidly built that it might be a few years before I need another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ronando

customer_reviews.title: Best trail shoes on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Update: "UNSTABLE" soles are way too thick for trail running, these are ankle breaker. Very expensive lawn mowing shoes. Too bad, they fit great and grip like Spider-Man. Too Best trail shoes on the market. The soles are a little think. Need thinner soles and less drop. Still better than any other trail shoe out there. Completed over 30 spartans and multiple hikes and trail runs with the speedcross 3 cs. Hope the 4s last as long. P.S. colors are very boring this year. Salomon needs to step it up.
customer_reviews.author: TODD DOW

customer_reviews.title: Salomon is my new favorite shoe brand
customer_reviews.text: A teammate wore these on our last Tough Mudder race, and said they are his "go to" for all outdoor activities...I bought a pair on his enthusiastic recommendation. I don't remember having shoes that were so comfortable right out of the box. I work outdoors in them, they're comfortable and look decent for causal dining out, and I've run steep uphill and downhill trails with them...I wear a size 14 with thick socks; I purchased a size 14 and they fit great. I add my recommendation to my friend's!
customer_reviews.author: Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Love Salomon
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a treat since I had some Amazon gift card money to spend. I always get the value running shoes, you know good quality but on sale. These are definitely worth the price. They are the best running shoes I've owned. I've gotten compliments and I have been using these with care like fine china. For a little less than $100, you get some happiness!
customer_reviews.author: stormbluehaze

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one for ordering shoes online because they never fit once I try them on. But this pair fits perfect and looks great. I've gotten a lot of compliments. I wear them as my every day shoe and so far they feel great especially when I'm standing for several hours. I'll definitely buy another pair when I've worn out this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Performance: I have not done a mud run yet with them, but I used these for Softball on a flooded field and they worked great - way better traction. Also have done some runs through grassy and sandy areas. The difference was amazing from crosstrainer shoes. In some cases I tripped because I no longer had to compensate on some loose terrain, especially when doing any sort of sharp pivoting. But I see that as a good thing. Sizing: I'm a 12 in casual Sketchers, 13 in Nike and Brooks running shoes. I got a 12.5 and the fit is perfect with your typical running sock. 12 would have been too tight, 13 would have been alright.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Stitt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with excellent support but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I personally own a pair, made for women, and they are perfect! So much so that I bought my husband a pair, but they fell short in the quality department (considering we just bought them in July) and now they are falling apart. Wish they were more durable considering the price... of not for that feature, I’d have given them a full 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves the shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husbands job requires him to be on his feet for much of the day in various terrain. He is often on gravel, sand, dirt, and sometimes cement. His feet was feeling quite terrible by the end of long days. These work great and he has noticed the difference almost immediately with the pain in his feet by the end of the day. He also loves how easy they are to tie, or rather not tie and just tighten. Will buy this brand again. The only thing we would change is a different color scheme, like brown/neutral.
customer_reviews.author: happymommy

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than usual and perform great because of it.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is great for the purpose it is intended for. Great grip, solid materials, they perform really good and on top of all, it has good looks. I realized they are little bit too narrow in the middle and the arch of my left foot was hurting after a few miles running with them. I know my left arch is a little bit lower than my right one. Decided to try them with special insoles I have and they don’t bother my feet any more, it’s just a few grams more to carry with me.
customer_reviews.author: Zheko Izaak

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor shoes
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes the minute I saw them. I've used them to run through the mountainside and in very difficult terrains and they haven't disappointed me. They have great grip and are very lightweight. Keep in mind these shoes are not waterproof (which in my opinion is better because they dry up quite quickly). However, these shoes are not ideal for pavement or road surfaces given the kind of sole it has, not only are you damaging the shoes but you're also exerting unnecessary effort into your feet.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes, but they don't last long.
customer_reviews.text: These are probably my favorite shoes. They are great for running on grass and trails, and I also wear them hiking, they have grip like a mountain goat! They also dry incredibly fast. My only small gripe is that the soles seem to wear out pretty fast. I wear these probably 80% of the time and they last me about six months. The rest of the shoe will be fine, but the tread will be bare in spots. UPDATE: I don't know if the colored sole is softer or what but I started wearing a new pair in June and the tread is completely worn down in spots. Pretty unacceptable durability.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew O.

customer_reviews.title: Salomons are the best shoe brand put there
customer_reviews.text: Salomons are the best shoe brand put there. The most comfortable shoe I ever had. Will def buy again and again. The only issue with this shoe is that you have to wear them for 1-2 months before they break in, become super comfy. They are designed for the trails, and you wear them as your every day shoe, then I'll be a while before the spikes wear in to your comfort zone. The picture is after 1 year of wearing and running in them everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Salomon SpeedCross 4 shoes. They are perfect for my foot and feel great even after a good 5 mile speed walk. The SpeedCross models are designed for supination issues. It is also a very snug fit. It might not be for everyone but if you are like me you will never want another shoe. I will add that my wife, who isn't bothered with supination issues, has also fallen in love with the ladies version. She also has several pairs.
customer_reviews.author: B****D**

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes but the thread on the inside rubs bad!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ran marathons and now I’m preparing for a 8 mile OCR. These are amazing shoes. Unfortunately the pair I got have one major flaw It may be isolated to just my shoe. The thread on my left shoe is very thick and corse on the inside of the shoe right where my pinky toe is and it rubs it raw in less than a mile run. It’s not an issue on the other shoe since the threads to protrude as much. Other than that I love everything about these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Post

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grip
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing! Ordered them for the Tough Mudder OCR (obstacle coarse run) after having a hard time in the Warrior Dash slipping and sliding and getting stuck in the muddy trails a couple months earlier after finding out they made shoes specifically for these events. Being a competitive person, I had to try these shoes out and loved them, no regrets. They hold good and have the best grip for the mud trails, no getting stuck and they are very lightweight so you almost forget you have them on. They also can be cleaned very well (hand wash only - very important) and easily and dried over night ready to be used again. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E-man

customer_reviews.title: Get Yourself a pair if you need a true all around activity shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are clearly the most comfortable activity shoes I’ve ever owned. Walking, hiking, bike riding, even running! This shoe has proved to be very breathable & flexible, as I have worn them with & w/o socks. Great quality in the stitching and it’s also very light & stylish. I’ve had a lot of people stop me & ask where I got them and how much they cost. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a shoe for a full weekend of activities, if it’s beaches, mountains, deserts, trails, zip lining or whatever your activities maybe!
customer_reviews.author: Alieus

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for obstacle races and after trying them last Saturday during a Super Spartan race, I am very happy I decided to get these shoes. Now, as mentioned by others, they're not that good at letting water out as other trail shoes, but other than that, the way they feel, the grip, and how light they felt made my race a perfect one.
customer_reviews.author: Yass

customer_reviews.title: Spartan Race Approved
customer_reviews.text: These shoes worked beautifully during my most recent Spartan Sprint. My buddy wore normal trail shoes and was sliding everywhere especially the slip wall. These shoes held tight to that wall and all the other obstacles. Will be wearing them again for my upcoming Spartan Super.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great as first used
customer_reviews.text: I always wonder how you write a review on a product when you haven't even used it for more than a week so really you can only can say I really like these shoes at this moment and will update the review to tell you how the shoe wears and last over time. I hope all understand reviews and what they mean, 1 month review, 3 month, a 4 month, and so on what are the time use of the products we read
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Spartan or other obstacle course race.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and fits perfectly. A little narrow, but I think that's fitting for my intended use. These shoes have good traction for trail or muddy surfaces. The laces can be a bit long when I lace the shoes tight, and since it's a loop, i can't exactly cut the excess. I've just had to tuck them in around the tongue. Overall, a good trail shoe that will hold up through any OCR.
customer_reviews.author: SupDanger

customer_reviews.title: Good traction
customer_reviews.text: These are the best all around trail runners. Good traction on all surfaces, wet and dry. I would like to see an all leather high top version. That would make them more rugged with better ankle support. The man made material stretches a little untill it rips, and rips easily on sharp rocks. The tread is soft and wears out before the sides split and become a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Happyhikes

customer_reviews.title: Too comfortable and soft, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this without knowing if it will fit even though I choose the correct size, but sometimes it happened that you can buy another brand like half more of your size and then go to another brand and maybe will be different size, but this one, fits perfectly, I've been using this a lot and it feels just comfortable and really soft in the inside. Quality just perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alaine C.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product, but a bad product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and paid for Speedcross 4 in July 2017, but when making a warranty claim on a defective shoestring clasp/tightener I discovered I was sent a Speedcross 3 that was manufactured in 2011. Of course, by then, too late for a return. So, poorly manufactured shoe (dead after 6 uses) and the wrong product to boot (no pun intended).
customer_reviews.author: A Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great for Softball!
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Boombah turfs with the expectation of purchasing another pair the following season. A friend of mine purchased a pair of Salomon turfs 3 years ago and his are still in game shape, so I decided to do the same. At first I was hesitant because they are normally upwards of $150-200 a pair. I was able to get a similar style on Amazon that was $94 shipped and I couldn't be happier. I highly recommend these for softball or outdoor running. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Grim

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoes! I wear size 9 (42
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes! I wear size 9 (42.5 euro) in Nike so I ordered size 9 (42.6 euro) in these and they fit perfect. The concerns about being too narrow expressed by others do not apply for average width feet. Tested on my usual trail these make a huge difference, amazing grip on loose terrain, firm sole, very comfortable upper, lacing system is awesome. I can see them wearing extremely fast if you use them on tarmac, these are very clearly not meant for the pavement. Extremely satisfied with my purchase. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: not the same
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sons birthday, 3 weeks in advance. When he opened them, one was smaller than the other and uncomfortable. not the seller fault, but manufacturers. I want to exchange them, but can't get a hold of the seller bc the return window is closed. due to me buying them early. Please advise me
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing athletic shoe
customer_reviews.text: never owed Solomons before and this is one of the greatest sneakers I've ever had.. best running shoe ever, grips the ground like fingers pulling you along .. I fly PPG and they give me PERFECT traction to get off the ground. Ill probably always own a new pare rest of my life!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but no way they can send wide size
customer_reviews.text: Let me start to say that the shoes are excellent, good quality nice looking, strong but i have to returned two times because they are not able to send the wide....wide word shows on the side of the shoes follow the speedcross 4 letters. So at this time still not getting the shoes giving now the third and last try.
customer_reviews.author: LorenzoG

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of Salomon shoes I have owned. I usually wear Brooks in a 13 W. I was expecting to send these back, but once I had tried them on, I'm not sending them back. For me they fit just right. The only thing I am having to get used to is the speed lacing system. The heal of the shoe seemed a little loose, but I was finally able to get them sinched up tight. Try a pair, you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Master Chief

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. More shoe than boot in terms of comfort. Aggressive tread outside but very cushy inside. Nice arch support. The quick lacing scheme seems handy. Very light weight. Can’t speak to the long term durability since I’ve only had them a couple of weeks, but they look solid. I have some heavier Salomon hiking boots (which I love) that are tough yet comfortable and these shoes match those qualities very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and grippy.
customer_reviews.text: My walking shoes were slipping on the trail I use everyday so I bought these for help. These shoes turned out to be perfect. No more slipping and they are so much lighter. Feels like I am getting more movement out of my feet when I am walking and keeping better contact with the ground. Could not be happier. I use them just for walking the trail and nothing else so they should last.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Chinn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing traction
customer_reviews.text: I wore these to the summit of Mount Ida, Chiefs Head and Longs Peak and couldn't have asked for better traction on the boulders. Without good traction, making those climbs would have been much more difficult. It was like there was glue on the bottom. After hiking all day, mostly on rocks and huge boulders, my feet did get sore. But I would still recommend these if you need serious traction
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Zeone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent traction and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes - I use them for competitive grass volleyball. They are super light weight but supportive and the grooves give perfect traction for side to side quick movements. Super easy to tighten - one-step pull. I bought one half size larger than my traditional foot size and it works perfect. My previous pair (same ones) were my exact foot size and pinched just a little. The awkward part is that the laces are so long once you tighten the shoe that you need to feed through the lower cross-lace and it still can hit the ground. No harm just odd.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis K

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow and Trail shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for winter running! Absolutely love this show! I wear it for jogging in the snow and ice. It has done a fantastic job. I’ve had it for about 3 weeeks of running and the grip is amazing on the snow and ice and the fit of the shoe is very comfortable. I bought the Speedcross 3 and the 4 and the 3 is definitely more bulky & klunky. So i returned the 3. The 4 is everything i want in a snow and trail shoe. It’s not water proof but rather water resistant. But i have not had any cold wet feet issues running in the snow and slush. As mentioned it’s a great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are comfortable and fit well
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable and fit well. I am not a big fan of the lacing system because the laces are too long when I tighten them, however I can resolve this by cutting them and probably using hot glue to glue them back together. The tread seems to be wearing out fairly quick as it seems to be fairly soft rubber. I have run in them and am enjoying them to wear around the house as well. Most impressive is the fit, I have narrower feet and seem to fit really well.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Third pair rhis year, of course I love them!
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of 4s this year and love them! Extremely tough shoe on the trail, well selected materials. I'm 200lbs and get about 430 miles on average out of them. Still plenty of tread, but my weight destroys the cushioning. I have been running 150-175 miles/month with some 52+mile weeks. No problems running through creeks then drying, fit well no blisters.
customer_reviews.author: M|

customer_reviews.title: Not the item that was advertised, no refund months later- Update Amazon issued refund.
customer_reviews.text: The item is advertised as a wide shoe but what arrived is regular model. Returned immediately, status says order was refunded but after waiting months still no credit has been applied to my credit card. Update: Amazon issued refund. Amount was incorrectly applied to a gift card but not issued.
customer_reviews.author: H1

customer_reviews.title: Obstacle Course Races
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes to participate in the Tough Mudder and Spartan Race. These shoes held up great and really helped when running through muck and water. After each race I threw them into the washing on gentle and air dried them and they look brand new still so they are very durable. My typical shoe size is a 13 and had to return the first pair and order a size 14 to get a good fit. I have already recommended these shoes to others and will continue to recommend them to new OCR runners.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Geer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for race day, not a training shoe...
customer_reviews.text: As a certified Salomon junkie, I had high expectations for this shoe going in. As usual Salomon did not disappoint. The build quality, materials, and fit were all as close to perfect as you could expect. Just putting them on makes you feel faster. With that said, after 40-50 miles of moderate trail running, I can say that I can't imagine doing more than a 10k in these. They reminded me of a modern version of my old Puma metal spike track shoes from high school. Cushioning is practically non-existent and swapping out insoles made the fit too tight to be comfortable. Great for a short trail race or Tough Mudder, but exhausting as a daily trainer.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Really, really good fit, quality, look and traction!  I'm a convert!
customer_reviews.text: I knew to order a little large based on the reviews and did so. These are honestly the most comfortable and best fitting shoes I own from this genre!! That includes Merrell, Columbia and Timberland to name a few. And I get traction better on smooth surfaces with these as well. I'm completely sold! Until they make something worse by updating the look or finding a new gimmick I'll be back for more from Salomon! I don't like their skis or bindings as well, but they sure got it right with these!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: It was smaller than expected and had to return it
customer_reviews.text: I returned this one because it was tighter than expected. Trail running needs lot of room or I will get my toenails purple and lose 3 or 4 nails.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Knight

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the wide size of these, but they not. These and they were too narrow and felt tight. The return process was great and without a hassle. I ended up getting these direct from Salomon (I paid more) in the correct wide size and they're great trail running sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T

customer_reviews.title: Great for softball! They run about a half size small.
customer_reviews.text: The Speedcross 4 are an excellent shoe for softball. I play 3 nights a week and on a travel team and they will last me a year. Much more comfortable than cleats, they are light, water resistant, and have a good grip tread for the ballfield. I learned after the first pair I purchased they run about a half size small (US Size) compared to Nike and Adidas brand turf shoes. (I wear a 12.50 and need to buy a 13 with these)
customer_reviews.author: Doolizon

customer_reviews.title: Go for it, fantastic shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use as an everyday winter shoe in snowy upstate NY. These shoes are very warm, the notches on the soles provide excellent grip, and I love the fast strap system instead of laces. The shoes repelled snow/water as well as I expected them to, though the tradeoff of that is that they don't breathe... at all. Still, for most use cases, this is an excellent shoe. I'm considering buying another pair now for whenever I wear mine out.
customer_reviews.author: replicacobra

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun per dollar
customer_reviews.text: I am just an amateur trail runner putting in about 10 miles each weekend in the extremely varied conditions here in the mountains of The Great Northwest. I also haven't tried many trail running shoes yet. But these shoes exceeded my expectations about, fit, comfort, stability and traction every time I used them this year. I was worried that they wouldn't work well or would survive the sharpest, rockiest trails, but they have been quite durable. For these reasons I give 5 stars even if they are pricey shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great traction.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my love. He was elated with the support of this shoe. His first Solomon's, he's hooked. We run on various terrain. These shoes are the best, they are durable. Provides that structural support one needs when running. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lover of all things fashion

customer_reviews.title: My 6th Pair
customer_reviews.text: I'm a complete FAN of my Speedcross 4 trail running shoes...... I live in Arizona and LOVE to hike/run the mountain trails around the Valley....The trails have sharp rocks, steep inclines, loose gravel, etc...... It's all in the tread..........They're super sticky and give me a firm footing in a variety of conditions....I feel like Spider Man going up and down the hill.....I combine them with "Active Ankle's" which together provide the support, comfort and confidence I need, when running down-hill (which my wife doesn't know I still do)...... In the past I strayed to different brands, but I knew immediately that it was a mistake....... I'm a lifelong supporter of this shoe!!
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these shoes twice now. I can do just about anything in them and they protect my feet. I've had just about every brand before but these fit better, last longer, and can be used for more activities than any shoes I've ever used before. Thank you Salomon.
customer_reviews.author: The Grand Coffee House

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Arch
customer_reviews.text: Shoe seems great and the delivery and packaging was perfect. The shoes are actually too narrow in the arch for my foot so this is definitely something to consider if you have a wide or kinda wide foot. I was not able to wear the shoe out on the trails or even a walk so I cannot comment on their durability, but the look and feel sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Strunk

customer_reviews.title: Junk for anything but a super expensive trial running only shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I love Salomon shoes. I have 2 pairs of Salomon boots. These are garbage. If you wear them for anything but trail running, they will wear incredibly fast. I had holes through the bottom within 3 months of owning the shoes. I contacted the company twice, and they they couldn't be bothered to respond to my calls/messages.
customer_reviews.author: wrb752

customer_reviews.title: Well worth them!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this brand,I've always been a Nike fan but after seeing a friend wearing these and hearing his experience with them I decided to give them a try and very pleased I did,well worth every cent and I even got my boyfriend to try on a pair and we left the store with them which is a total shocker because he doesn't think spending more than $50 on a pair of shoes is worth it,well let me tell you,he no longer feels that way.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket47)

customer_reviews.title: Good grip
customer_reviews.text: I use these in the Nevada desert for hiking even though they are made for trail running. Lots of gravelly steep trails here and these work very well. They run a little small and the arch support is not the best but they are designed more for running than hiking. Iv'e put about a hundred miles on them so far and they are holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan  Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. Took them for a hike/trail jog to work and back today, having gotten them in the mail yesterday and worenthem around the house a bunch last night. As a woman with very long and narrow feet ( women's 12–13), these men's 11 1/2 fit better than most shoes I have tried. I am taking them on a backpacking trip in North Carolina in a couple of weeks and have high hopes for them.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Langford

customer_reviews.title: Sent me someone else’s used shoes
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered men’s 10 and I really liked them but they where a little small, so I returned and ordered 10.5 . I was very excited because they came in 2 days ... until I open the box and they are obviously used shoes . No packing material, tags , new shoe smell . They have obviously been worn for some time and scuffed up and half the tread is gone... pretty gross !!😡😡
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: fantastic for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a spartan race, but the human malware struck :( - it got canceled. I've used them on a couple hikes and have been VERY pleased with them. They are comfy on the hike. And the tread design allows plenty of bite when going up and down a hill.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Stein

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE MONEY IF YOU OCR
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used these was for a Spartan Beast and let me tell you, they were a life saver. The Beast was miserable, thick mud, Raining, 40 degrees, etc. But if I hadn't had these I probably would've lost my shoes in the mud or fallen at least 50x. I was happily surprised that my feet didn't hurt at the end of 15miles, esp since this was the first time I'd worn them and my feet are insanely sensitive. So worth the cost of you do obstacle course racing (was hard to get all the mud out and off but it would happen with any shoe in those conditions)
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: 12 Mile Tough Mudder completed
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a 12 mile Tough Mudder. They fit rather tight and are a little long. I typically wear a size 9.5 but ended up running in a size 10. The toe would trip me up but they worked great and I was able to get through most obstacles better than those around me. When I first put them on they did hurt my feet but that all went away once the race started. I did end up hurting my right foot by jumping over a creek and kinked my foot during takeoff but I don't blame the shoe for it.
customer_reviews.author: Timk

customer_reviews.title: Great traction, comfortable fit - but buy one size larger than normal!!
customer_reviews.text: Got the right size on the second try - first was too small. Now they fit, I love them! I bought them for traction in the rain, wet muddy grass as well as on the road. They grip *really* well climbing up wet grassy embankments and have been fine on steep gravel/ stone pathways in the wet. I need to get another pair as I don't think I can go back to my old road shoes after these...
customer_reviews.author: Von Steiner

customer_reviews.title: 3 Spartan Races including Beast. Best shoe for sure.
customer_reviews.text: The only must-have for an obstacle course race. These shoes never slipped and eliminated problems that every person running the race who had normal running shoes had. You will slip and possibly not be able to do 5-10 obstacles if you are wearing normal running shoes. The tuck away lace pocket is a win. No issues and will definitely buy again if I ever need to. I’ve done the Spartan Trifecta with this one pair and they still look brand new with me finishing in the top 25% of each race. Wash them off after the race and shelve them inside until the next one.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: Supportive, Durable, and Grippy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband before his running test for taekwondo. It was a 6 mile trail run rain or shine. He got them 2 weeks before the test so he could try them out. He says they grip really well and he never feels like he’s slipping, even when the trail is muddy. He’s been running in them on the same trail 3-4 times a week since then and they’re still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: aubrey54

product_meta.title: Salomon Men's Speedcross 4 Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description:
The 4Th edition of our iconic and aggressively lugged trail runner for tearing through technical, soft ground with speed.

Salomon was born in 1947 in the heart of the French Alps and the birthplace of modern alpinism. Driven by a passion for skiing and design innovation, Francois Salomon and his son George designed and perfected much of the first modern ski equipment. During the following 60 years, Salomon's commitment to innovative design and passion for mountain sports created a vast range of revolutionary new concepts in boots, skis and apparel and brought innovative solutions to footwear, apparel and equipment for hiking, adventure racing, mountaineering and trail running. Through performance-driven design, Salomon enhances mountain sports by converting new ideas into action and expanding the limits of possibility.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
Agressive Grip : Obvious and penetrating traction on soft ground
Precise Foothold : Close-to-foot and comfortable feel
Contragrip rubber sole; MIDSOLE HEIGHT : 30mm/20mm (10mm drop);WEIGHT: 310g
Aggressive Grip : Obvious and penetrating traction on soft ground , minimalistic and strong lace for one-pull tightening. Easy-on, easy-off
EVA midsole provides lighweight cushioning and stability
